pageProps.title: Components
pageProps.description: Discover all the Agriculture Design System components here including visual examples, component props, and live code examples.

pkgList.title: A11y
pkgList.description: Utilities for improving accessibility.

pkgList.title: AG branding
pkgList.description: A colour palette and logo set for Agriculture

pkgList.title: Accordion
pkgList.description: An accordion lets users show and hide sections of related content.

pkgList.title: App layout
pkgList.description: The app layout provides a consistent way for users to navigate around a web application and access their account settings.

pkgList.title: Autocomplete
pkgList.description: Autocomplete, also known as type-ahead, uses predictive text to help select options as a user types.

pkgList.title: Avatar
pkgList.description: User avatars help to quickly identify people in the system.

pkgList.title: Box
pkgList.description: A primitive layout component.

pkgList.title: Breadcrumbs
pkgList.description: Breadcrumbs show a user their location on a website so they can easily navigate to find what they need.

pkgList.title: Button
pkgList.description: A button communicates an action to a user and indicates what will happen next.

pkgList.title: Call to action
pkgList.description: Call to action links are interactive UI cues that direct users to other pages.

pkgList.title: Callout
pkgList.description: Callouts are an excerpt of text used to draw attention to important or interesting information. They should not be confused with Page alerts.

pkgList.title: Card
pkgList.description: Also known as Tiles, Cards are a layout component that link to more information on a topic.

pkgList.title: Checkbox
pkgList.description: Checkboxes allow users to select one or more options from a list.

pkgList.title: Columns
pkgList.description: Columns allows you to create a responsive layout grid.

pkgList.title: Combobox
pkgList.description: This component allows users to select from a list of options. Itâ€™s especially useful when there are many options to choose from.

pkgList.title: Content
pkgList.description: A collection of simple layout containers to wrap content.

pkgList.title: Control group
pkgList.description: Control groups allow related checkboxes and radios to be grouped together.

pkgList.title: Core
pkgList.description: Core includes a range of styles, variables and code that form the foundations of how the Design System works, including colour, typography and spacing.

pkgList.title: Date picker
pkgList.description: The Date picker component allows users to select a single date via a calendar or text input.

pkgList.title: Date picker (Next)
pkgList.description: The Date picker component allows users to select a single date via a calendar or text input.

pkgList.title: Date range picker
pkgList.description: The Date range picker component allows users to select a range of dates via a calendar or text input.

pkgList.title: Date range picker (Next)
pkgList.description: The Date range picker component allows users to select a range of dates via a calendar or text input.

pkgList.title: Details
pkgList.description: The Details component hides non-essential content unless a user explicitly chooses to view it.

pkgList.title: Direction link
pkgList.description: Direction links are links which communicate flow to other parts of a page or process.

pkgList.title: Divider
pkgList.description: A horizontal rule that separates blocks of content.

pkgList.title: Drawer
pkgList.description: A drawer is a panel that slides in from the right side of the screen. The Drawer is overlayed on top of the main area of the page to capture the userâ€™s attention while keeping the context of the current task.

pkgList.title: Dropdown menu
pkgList.description: A dropdown menu displays a list of actions when a trigger is pressed.

pkgList.title: Feature link list
pkgList.description: Feature link list is a vertical list of important links. It adds prominence and additional information to help users find and understand the navigation items.

pkgList.title: Field
pkgList.description: The field package exposes the elements around form inputs, and an API to compose them.

pkgList.title: Fieldset
pkgList.description: The Fieldset component is used to group related form fields and includes a descriptive legend to label the group, helping users understand the relationship between these form fields.

pkgList.title: File input
pkgList.description: The File input component allows users to attach one file to a form field by browsing their device.

pkgList.title: File upload
pkgList.description: The File upload component allows users to attach one or multiple files to a form via drag-and-drop or by browsing their device.

pkgList.title: Filter sidebar
pkgList.description: Filter sidebar is used for displaying filtering options in a search result or catalogue page.

pkgList.title: Flex
pkgList.description: A CSS flexbox version of the Box component.

pkgList.title: Footer
pkgList.description: Footers live at the bottom of a page and help users find supplementary information relevant to their needs.

pkgList.title: Form stack
pkgList.description: The Form stack component is used to apply consistent vertical spacing between elements in forms.

pkgList.title: Global alert
pkgList.description: Global alerts display prominent service or system wide messages at the top of the screen.

pkgList.title: Grouped fields
pkgList.description: The Grouped fields component allows two closely related form inputs to be grouped together.

pkgList.title: Header
pkgList.description: The Header is the masthead of our applications. It incorporates the Department of Agriculture, Fisheries and Forestry Coat of Arms logo and provides a user context on where they are.

pkgList.title: Heading
pkgList.description: Headings are a typographic component that create semantic structure, allow users to scan content by creating relative visual prominence and support search engine optimisation.

pkgList.title: Hero banner
pkgList.description: The hero banner sits at the top of the page under the Main nav and is used to grab a userâ€™s attention.

pkgList.title: Icon
pkgList.description: The Agriculture Design System supports the use of universal system icons. The icon component is used to apply our set of universal icons to more complex components of the system.

pkgList.title: Indicator dot
pkgList.description: Indicator dots are small, decorative, badge-like indicators used to call attention to an item, such as an unread message.

pkgList.title: Inpage nav
pkgList.description: Also known as Page contents, Inpage nav links help users scan page contents and quickly navigate to different sections.

pkgList.title: Link list
pkgList.description: Link list is a simple set of vertical or horizontal links used for site navigation and to order information for users.

pkgList.title: List
pkgList.description: Lists are vertical groupings of related items that can be displayed either in an unordered or ordered format.

pkgList.title: Loading
pkgList.description: Loading indicators inform users their action is being processed.

pkgList.title: Main nav
pkgList.description: The main nav is the primary way users navigate the user interface. It is consistently visible throughout the service.

pkgList.title: Modal
pkgList.description: A modal is a dialog box that appears above the parent page and provides advance notice of a destructive action and consequence. They tell users a decision is needed.

pkgList.title: Notification badge
pkgList.description: Notification badges are visual indicators for numeric values.

pkgList.title: Page alert
pkgList.description: Page alerts are colour-coded, non-disruptive notifications that provide Success, Error, Warning or Information messages at relevant times during the user journey. They should not be confused with Callouts.

pkgList.title: Pagination
pkgList.description: Pagination separates large amounts of content into separate pages, which helps reduce cognitive load.

pkgList.title: Password input
pkgList.description: The password input component allows users to securely enter a password. The text is obscured by default, but can be revealed by pressing the â€˜Show passwordâ€™ checkbox.

pkgList.title: Progress indicator
pkgList.description: Progress indicators show users the number of steps in a task, where they are up to in the process and how much is left to do.

pkgList.title: Prose
pkgList.description: Provides typographic defaults for vanilla HTML.

pkgList.title: Radio
pkgList.description: Radios allow users to select one option from a list.

pkgList.title: Search box
pkgList.description: An input that allows users to enter a keyword to search a website for specific content.

pkgList.title: Search input
pkgList.description: Search input enables users to enter a word or phrase to find relevant content.

pkgList.title: Section alert
pkgList.description: Section alerts are non-disruptive notifications that provide Success, Error and Warning messages about a state change in a section of a page.

pkgList.title: Select
pkgList.description: Select provides a way for users to choose one item from a collapsible list. It helps reduce input errors and screen space.

pkgList.title: Side nav
pkgList.description: A vertical list of links used for site navigation, typically placed beside body content.

pkgList.title: Skeleton
pkgList.description: Skeletons are visual placeholders for information while data is still loading.

pkgList.title: Skip link
pkgList.description: Skip links are internal page links that aid navigation around a page. They are accessible by screen reader and keyboard users, and help users quickly jump to and over content on the page.

pkgList.title: Stack
pkgList.description: Stack is a primitive layout component used to distribute items vertically with even spacing.

pkgList.title: Status badge
pkgList.description: Status badges are visual indicators used to highlight an itemâ€™s status for quick recognition.

pkgList.title: Sub nav
pkgList.description: A horizontal list of links typically placed between the main navigation and page content.

pkgList.title: Summary list
pkgList.description: Summary list is used to summarise information such as a userâ€™s responses at the end of a form.

pkgList.title: Switch
pkgList.description: A Switch allows a user to immediately toggle interface settings.

pkgList.title: Table
pkgList.description: Tables help make complex information easier to scan and compare. Use tables for exact values or information that would be hard to read in body text.

pkgList.title: Tabs
pkgList.description: Tabs are used to categorise content into seperate views. A user can navigate between each section of content, displaying one section at a time.

pkgList.title: Tags
pkgList.description: Tags classify content using keywords or labels. They are added to a web page, asset or content to help users search for related content quickly and easily.

pkgList.title: Task list
pkgList.description: Task list is a navigation tool that show users what input is required to complete a task or transaction.

pkgList.title: Text
pkgList.description: A primitive typographic component for constrained text styles.

pkgList.title: Text input
pkgList.description: This component allows users to enter free-form text.

pkgList.title: Text link
pkgList.description: A typographic component for creating hyperlinks.

pkgList.title: Textarea
pkgList.description: A text area lets users enter long-form, plain text over multiple lines and is commonly found in forms.

pkgList.title: Time input
pkgList.description: The Time input component allows users to enter a time in multiple formats.

pkgList.title: Time picker
pkgList.description: The Time picker component allows users to easily select a time from a list of options.

pkgList.title: Toggle button
pkgList.description: Toggle button is a two-state button that represents and performs an on/off state.
